Dear Barry

I was very interested by the article that you posted on namban =
tetsu, 
but am a little unhappy about the implied supposition that cannon f=
rom 
the 'De Liefde' were the original source of this metal.

I had believe=
d that bronze - a mixture of 90% copper and 10% tin - was 
the preferred me=
tal used for the casting of cannon.  Although cast-iron 
cannon became avai=
lable ca 1550, these were much more difficult to 
cast, and bronze remained=
 the metal of choice until the mid to late 
C17.  Since the 'De Liefde' arr=
ived in Kyushu in 1600, is it not highly 
likely that its cannon were of br=
onze rather than of iron?

Is there an expert on cannon out there somewhere=
 who can clarify this 
point for me?

Regards, John L.
